title: China Eximbank provides RMB 487 million government concessional loan for Greater Kurunegala Water Supply & Sanitation Project
description: On September 18, 2013, China Eximbank and the Government of Sri Lanka signed an RMB 487,016,800 government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK (2013) 31 TOTAL NO (476)] for the Greater Kurunegala Water Supply & Sanitation Project. The GCL carries the following borrowing terms: a 2% interest rate, a 5 year grace period, a maturity of 20 years, a 0.25% management fee, and a 0.25% commitment fee. China Eximbank disbursed RMB 129,294,990.84 in 2014, RMB 71,322,224.62 in 2015, RMB 50,827,659.58 in 2016, RMB 116,375,945.72 in 2017, RMB 190,284,964 in 2018, and RMB 45,285,961 in 2019. The loan had achieved a 123.8% disbursement rate (RMB 603,391,745.76 out of RMB 487,016,800) as of December 31, 2019. The borrower made no repayments in 2018. The borrower made repayments worth RMB 32,467,786 in 2019, RMB 32,467,787 in 2020 and RMB 32,467,787 in 2021. The loan's amount outstanding was RMB 251,444,875 as of December 31, 2017, RMB 441,729,839 as of December 31, 2018, RMB 454,548,014 as of December 31, 2019, RMB 422,081,227 as of December 31, 2020, RMB 389,613,440 as of December 31, 2021, and RMB 373,379,547 as of June 30, 2022.   By early 2022, it was clear that the loan was non-performing. On April 12, 2022, the Government of Sri Lanka announced a ‘pre-emptive’ sovereign debt default, noting that it would suspend debt repayments to all external creditors other than multilateral institutions. Its decision to suspend external debt service reportedly affected all China Eximbank loans with amounts outstanding at the time of the announcement.   The objective of the project was to meet the present and future demand of drinking water in the Greater Kurunegala area by increasing water supply capacity from 6500m3/d to 13000m3/d and establishing a proper waste water disposal system with a capacity 0f 4500m3/d. This project involved the construction of a new treatment plant, a pipe sewer network (135 km), water transmission lines(8km), water distribution network (110km), and two elevated water towers (Kurunagala 1750 m3/d, 750 m3/d at Vahara).   China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. The project commenced on February 26, 2014 and was completed on August 13, 2018. Upon completion, the project reportedly covered 397 square kilometers and solved the problem of access to clean drinking water for 600,000 people in 42 villages.
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese project title is 斯里兰卡库鲁内格勒供水和污水处理项目. This project is also known as the Greater Kurunegala Water Supply & Sanitation (Sewerage) Project. 2. The Government of Sri Lanka loan key number is 2013041. 3. One source identifies the 2018 loan disbursement amount as RMB 119,195,979.24. This issue warrants further investigation.
combined_text:
# Sector
WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION

# Title
China Eximbank provides RMB 487 million government concessional loan for Greater Kurunegala Water Supply & Sanitation Project

# Description
On September 18, 2013, China Eximbank and the Government of Sri Lanka signed an RMB 487,016,800 government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK (2013) 31 TOTAL NO (476)] for the Greater Kurunegala Water Supply & Sanitation Project. The GCL carries the following borrowing terms: a 2% interest rate, a 5 year grace period, a maturity of 20 years, a 0.25% management fee, and a 0.25% commitment fee. China Eximbank disbursed RMB 129,294,990.84 in 2014, RMB 71,322,224.62 in 2015, RMB 50,827,659.58 in 2016, RMB 116,375,945.72 in 2017, RMB 190,284,964 in 2018, and RMB 45,285,961 in 2019. The loan had achieved a 123.8% disbursement rate (RMB 603,391,745.76 out of RMB 487,016,800) as of December 31, 2019. The borrower made no repayments in 2018. The borrower made repayments worth RMB 32,467,786 in 2019, RMB 32,467,787 in 2020 and RMB 32,467,787 in 2021. The loan's amount outstanding was RMB 251,444,875 as of December 31, 2017, RMB 441,729,839 as of December 31, 2018, RMB 454,548,014 as of December 31, 2019, RMB 422,081,227 as of December 31, 2020, RMB 389,613,440 as of December 31, 2021, and RMB 373,379,547 as of June 30, 2022.   By early 2022, it was clear that the loan was non-performing. On April 12, 2022, the Government of Sri Lanka announced a ‘pre-emptive’ sovereign debt default, noting that it would suspend debt repayments to all external creditors other than multilateral institutions. Its decision to suspend external debt service reportedly affected all China Eximbank loans with amounts outstanding at the time of the announcement.   The objective of the project was to meet the present and future demand of drinking water in the Greater Kurunegala area by increasing water supply capacity from 6500m3/d to 13000m3/d and establishing a proper waste water disposal system with a capacity 0f 4500m3/d. This project involved the construction of a new treatment plant, a pipe sewer network (135 km), water transmission lines(8km), water distribution network (110km), and two elevated water towers (Kurunagala 1750 m3/d, 750 m3/d at Vahara).   China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. The project commenced on February 26, 2014 and was completed on August 13, 2018. Upon completion, the project reportedly covered 397 square kilometers and solved the problem of access to clean drinking water for 600,000 people in 42 villages.
justification: Project focuses on water supply and sanitation infrastructure without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of water treatment plant, sewer network, and distribution system for drinking water and wastewater disposal

title: China donates agricultural equipment to Darfur region
description: On March 4, 2013, the Sudanese government received a donation from the Chinese government as part of China's humanitarian assistance to Sudan's Darfur region. The donation, which was the third batch, consisted of 1,000 units of irrigation, agricultural machinery and maintenance equipment. The donation delivery ceremony was attended by the Sundanese and Chinese representatives in the presence of the Sudanese Interior Minister, the Humanitarian Aid Commissioner and the Chinese Ambassador to Sudan.  The value of the donation is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
China donates agricultural equipment to Darfur region

# Description
On March 4, 2013, the Sudanese government received a donation from the Chinese government as part of China's humanitarian assistance to Sudan's Darfur region. The donation, which was the third batch, consisted of 1,000 units of irrigation, agricultural machinery and maintenance equipment. The donation delivery ceremony was attended by the Sundanese and Chinese representatives in the presence of the Sudanese Interior Minister, the Humanitarian Aid Commissioner and the Chinese Ambassador to Sudan.  The value of the donation is unknown.
justification: Project focuses on humanitarian assistance and agricultural development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of agricultural equipment for humanitarian purposes in Darfur region

title: Chinese UN peacekeepers construct China-Sudan Friendship Road in Sudan
description: In November 2007, Chinese UN peacekeepers  began work on the construction of the 3km China-Sudan Friendship Road in Ed Daein, East Darfur State of Sudan. The road was built with Chinese personnel and equipment; the peacekeepers also helped the local people drill wells, treat illnesses, provide medicines and build a China-Sudan Friendship School. Construction of the road finished in December 2013.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
Chinese UN peacekeepers construct China-Sudan Friendship Road in Sudan

# Description
In November 2007, Chinese UN peacekeepers  began work on the construction of the 3km China-Sudan Friendship Road in Ed Daein, East Darfur State of Sudan. The road was built with Chinese personnel and equipment; the peacekeepers also helped the local people drill wells, treat illnesses, provide medicines and build a China-Sudan Friendship School. Construction of the road finished in December 2013.
justification: Road construction project with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: 3km road construction, social development components (wells, school, medical aid)

title: Chinese embassy and Chinese-funded enterprises in Sudan donate aid materials to flood-hit Sudanese
description: On August 21, 2013, officials from the Chinese Embassy in Sudan met with the Sanad Charity Foundation in Khartoum to provide humanitarian aid including blankets, mosquito nets, shelter, and other materials to people in the Karary locality, north of Khartoum, affected by rain and flooding.  The same day, Chinese Embassy officials and representatives from Chinese-funded enterprises in Sudan traveled to Karary to deliver relief supplies. The assistance provided by the Chinese Embassy was worth about 300,000 Sudanese pounds (about $68,000 USD).
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese embassy and Chinese-funded enterprises in Sudan donate aid materials to flood-hit Sudanese

# Description
On August 21, 2013, officials from the Chinese Embassy in Sudan met with the Sanad Charity Foundation in Khartoum to provide humanitarian aid including blankets, mosquito nets, shelter, and other materials to people in the Karary locality, north of Khartoum, affected by rain and flooding.  The same day, Chinese Embassy officials and representatives from Chinese-funded enterprises in Sudan traveled to Karary to deliver relief supplies. The assistance provided by the Chinese Embassy was worth about 300,000 Sudanese pounds (about $68,000 USD).
justification: Project involves humanitarian aid with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of blankets, mosquito nets, shelter, and other materials for flood relief

title: ZTE Donates Waterproof Bags to Schoolchildren
description: In 2013, Chinese telecommunications company Zhongxing Telecommunication Equipment (ZTE) donated over 1,000 waterproof bags to schoolchildren in Urur county, Jonglei state in Sudan. This donation is part of over ten thousand that are being donated to help school children protect their books during the rainy season. The donation was handed over to Dr. Barnaba Marial Benjamin, the minister of Foreign Affairs and member of Parliament representing Uror County.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
ZTE Donates Waterproof Bags to Schoolchildren

# Description
In 2013, Chinese telecommunications company Zhongxing Telecommunication Equipment (ZTE) donated over 1,000 waterproof bags to schoolchildren in Urur county, Jonglei state in Sudan. This donation is part of over ten thousand that are being donated to help school children protect their books during the rainy season. The donation was handed over to Dr. Barnaba Marial Benjamin, the minister of Foreign Affairs and member of Parliament representing Uror County.
justification: Project is a social development initiative with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of waterproof bags to schoolchildren, education sector focus

title: Sinohydro Engineering Bureau 7 donates 50,000 Sudanese pounds to help flood refugees (linked to #30789)
description: On August 21, 2013, POWERCHINA's subsidiary -- Sinohydro Engineering Bureau 7 -- donated 50,000 Sudanese pounds ($11,355) to flood refugees in Sudan. The donation ceremony was organized by the Chinese Embassy and Economic Counselor's Office where they, too, made a donation to Sudanese flood victims (see linked ProjectID#30789). Many Chinese enterprises in Sudan actively participated in the event.  Some regions and states in Sudan suffered severe flooding during the rainy season in 2013, and the persistent heavy rains caused large scale damage on buildings and infrastructure, such as roads. Hundreds were injured or killed.
combined_text:
# Sector

title: Chinese Government dispatches 31st Chinese medical team to Abu Ushar Friendship Hospital, Omdurman Friendship Hospital, and Ad-Damazin Friendship Hospital
description: The Chinese Government has been sending medical teams to Sudan every two years since April 1971. Shaanxi Province has been responsible for sending the teams.  On 7 February 2013, Chinese Ambassador to Sudan, Luo Xiaoguang, and Sudan’s Minister of Health, Issam Ding, signed a protocol agreement dispatching the 31st medical team to Sudan. The 42-member team was stationed at the Abu Ushar Friendship Hospital, Omdurman Friendship Hospital, and Ad-Damazin Friendship Hospital, all of which were previously built with funding from the Chinese Government.  The team completed its term of service between August 2013 and 2015.  During a 2013 interview, the captain of the 31st medical team stated that the cumulative number of patients seen by all 31 Chinese medical teams in Sudan was 7.78 million.  250,000 of these patients were hospitalized and 160,000 patients received surgery.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 31st Chinese medical team to Abu Ushar Friendship Hospital, Omdurman Friendship Hospital, and Ad-Damazin Friendship Hospital

# Description
The Chinese Government has been sending medical teams to Sudan every two years since April 1971. Shaanxi Province has been responsible for sending the teams.  On 7 February 2013, Chinese Ambassador to Sudan, Luo Xiaoguang, and Sudan’s Minister of Health, Issam Ding, signed a protocol agreement dispatching the 31st medical team to Sudan. The 42-member team was stationed at the Abu Ushar Friendship Hospital, Omdurman Friendship Hospital, and Ad-Damazin Friendship Hospital, all of which were previously built with funding from the Chinese Government.  The team completed its term of service between August 2013 and 2015.  During a 2013 interview, the captain of the 31st medical team stated that the cumulative number of patients seen by all 31 Chinese medical teams in Sudan was 7.78 million.  250,000 of these patients were hospitalized and 160,000 patients received surgery.
justification: Project involves medical assistance and healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Dispatch of medical team, healthcare services provided, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: China provides 100 buses to Sudan for transport enhancement
description: On August 6, 2013, the Chinese government pledged to grant 100 buses to the Sudanese government free of charge. The project was implemented by China FAW Group Import & Export Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of FAW Group. The buses arrived in Sudan on January 22, 2014, and China officially delivered the vehicles to the Sudanese government during a ceremony in Khartoum on April 9, 2014, where the Khartoum State Governor Abdul-Rahman Al-Khadir and the Chinese Ambassador to Sudan Luo Xiaoguang signed a certificate handing them over.  The value of the buses is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
China provides 100 buses to Sudan for transport enhancement

# Description
On August 6, 2013, the Chinese government pledged to grant 100 buses to the Sudanese government free of charge. The project was implemented by China FAW Group Import & Export Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of FAW Group. The buses arrived in Sudan on January 22, 2014, and China officially delivered the vehicles to the Sudanese government during a ceremony in Khartoum on April 9, 2014, where the Khartoum State Governor Abdul-Rahman Al-Khadir and the Chinese Ambassador to Sudan Luo Xiaoguang signed a certificate handing them over.  The value of the buses is unknown.
justification: Project involves provision of buses for public transport without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: 100 buses provided for transport enhancement, no mention of energy type or environmental features

title: Chinese government grants mobile solar power equipment to Sudan (linked to project #55931)
description: On August 7, 2013, Chinese ambassador to Sudan Luo Xiaoguang signed and submitted a letter to Sudan pledging to help Sudan with a solar mobile power project. On August 14, 2013, Sultan ’s Minister of National Economy and Finance Ali Mahmoud Abdullah Soul replies to the Sudanese government for confirmation. Under the framework of "China-Africa Non-governmental Friendship Action", the Chinese Embassy in Sudan cooperated with the Sanad Charitable Foundation of Sudan to fund for this project. The value of the grant is unknown.  Solar equipment was built by Poly New Energy Technology (Beijing) Co., Ltd. and was officially delivered to Sudan on June 1, 2014.  The equipment was intended to be distributed to rural areas which suffer from power shortages. The Chinese Embassy also funded the donation of solar streetlights captured in #55931.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
Chinese government grants mobile solar power equipment to Sudan (linked to project #55931)

# Description
On August 7, 2013, Chinese ambassador to Sudan Luo Xiaoguang signed and submitted a letter to Sudan pledging to help Sudan with a solar mobile power project. On August 14, 2013, Sultan ’s Minister of National Economy and Finance Ali Mahmoud Abdullah Soul replies to the Sudanese government for confirmation. Under the framework of "China-Africa Non-governmental Friendship Action", the Chinese Embassy in Sudan cooperated with the Sanad Charitable Foundation of Sudan to fund for this project. The value of the grant is unknown.  Solar equipment was built by Poly New Energy Technology (Beijing) Co., Ltd. and was officially delivered to Sudan on June 1, 2014.  The equipment was intended to be distributed to rural areas which suffer from power shortages. The Chinese Embassy also funded the donation of solar streetlights captured in #55931.
justification: Primary purpose is solar power generation for rural electrification
evidence: Mobile solar power equipment, focus on rural power shortages, solar streetlights

title: Chinese Embassy in Sudan donates flood relief supplies to Sudanese Women's Union
description: On September 12, 2013, the Chinese Embassy in Sudan and unspecified Chinese-funded enterprises in Sudan donated flood relief supplies to the Sudanese Women's Union in Khartoum (中国驻苏使馆及在苏中资企业向苏丹妇盟捐赠抗洪救灾物资). The Chinese Ambassador to Sudan Luo Xiaoguang and the President of the Sudanese Women's Union Igbar signed the documents formally handing over the materials. The donation was made by Chinese Embassy in Sudan and Chinese-funded enterprises in Sudan.
staff_comments: The exact amount and type of supplies donated, as well as their monetary value, are unknown.
combined_text:

The Chinese Ambassador to Sudan Luo Xiaoguang and the President of the Sudanese Women's Union Igbar signed the documents formally handing over the materials. justification: Project is focused on humanitarian aid and disaster relief, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
